shortdesc.ph: Starts a local audio playback device test.

section.p: This method tests whether the local audio playback device is working properly. After you call this method, the SDK plays the specified audio file. If you can hear the sound, the playback device is working properly. After this method is called, the SDK triggers the callback every 100 ms, reporting the volume information of uid = 1 and the playback device. The difference between this method and is that only tests the local audio playback device, while tests both audio/video devices and network conditions.
section.note: Call this method before joining a channel. After the test is complete, call to stop the test before joining a channel.

plentry.pd: The path of the audio file, a UTF-8 encoded string. Supported file formats include wav, mp3, m4a, and aac. Supported sampling rates include 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, and 48000 Hz.
